item.title: ‘Those in power are often the biggest obstacles to justice’
item.description: To uncover the truth, we need to start with self-criticism.

item.description: The Land Crime Prevention and Remedy Act, 2023 was enacted to expedite the resolution of land-related disputes outside the courtroom through an administrative process. item.title: Finding balance between revenue and nature
Saving our nation from the climate crisis
The perks and pitfalls of globalization
Growing into their shoes
Dhaka’s gridlock is a crisis of coordination
item.description: Dhaka was, and for much of its population remains, a city of non-motorised transport. Rickshaws once made up as much as 85 percent of vehicular traffic.

item.title: End menstrual health crisis of tea workers
item.description: Garden owners must ensure proper toilets, sanitary facilities for women workers

item.title: ‘The Fourth Estate will not survive unless defended’
item.description: Martin Moore and Thomas Colley, authors of Dictating Reality: The Global Battle to Control the News (2025), discuss how governments worldwide manipulate the media, reshape public perception, and construct competing realities in an age of digital disinformation. The interview was conducted by Shamsuddoza Sajen of The Daily Star.

item.title: ‘The Fourth Estate will not survive unless defended’

item.title: Social media abuse reaches breaking point
Air pollution is not just an outdoor problem, but an indoor one too
Journalists cannot be safe if power remains unaccountable
item.description: Several journalists have been killed in the last two years alone.
